adrFormatAddress: 39 W 29th St 9th floor, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Store supplying industrial, security, hospitality & medical uniforms & work wear.

originalText.text: I had a wonderful experience at SPADA. I arrived at about 8:15 a.m. knowing that they open at 8:30 a.m. I just wanted to beat the crowd. I signed in and at 8:47a.m GiGi gave me a call. She was fantastic. Exceptional Customer Service across the board.

text.text: I had a wonderful experience at SPADA. I arrived at about 8:15 a.m. knowing that they open at 8:30 a.m. I just wanted to beat the crowd. I signed in and at 8:47a.m GiGi gave me a call. She was fantastic. Exceptional Customer Service across the board.

originalText.text: This place is meduim size. They have elevators. They have a wheelchair accessible entrance. The girl in the front desk is nice she tells you to sign in and gives you a number. You have to wait until your number is called. It's always packed. Theres always other people waiting to be seen or waiting to pick up their uniforms. The staff speak English and Spanish. onece your number is called you give them the sheet of paper that your employer gives you, then they get the uniform, and you try it on so they can fix it if they need to. then they tell you to wait outside for ur uniform. When they call you, you get your uniform, and then you can leave. The waiting time  is long. you can wait for 30 minutes, sometimes even an hour. They do not accept no kids, so come alone. All the staff was nice and helpful.

originalText.text:
This place is horrible for many reasons:
1. no one speaks English except for whoever is by the sign in desk.

2. they never have everything when you go to pick up .everything is on "special order" so you'll have to make multiple trips to pick up a fraction of your uniform.

3. communication is not key here , they gave me the wrong ties .my company informed them what ties we were suppose to have and when I got there Marrissa said I already got the ties.you all need to communicate properly.

4. When I went back the second time they took two months to get my vest and then (drum roll) ,they got the wrong size ðŸ˜‘

*common sense spada get your inventory in order because a guard can't work if he doesn't have all the pieces to his uniform .He/she will have to wait to work if your just hiring one 12 year old in a sweat shop to make the clothing the guard doesn't have yet.

originalText.text: It's very pact and I came early. Do not bring anyone with you there is no space. You have to sign in at the desk, there is no one to direct you. Just tap the glass and speak to the woman at the desk. Be ready to stand for two and a half hours (I did) and don't block the doors. The floors are dirty, the lighting is dim, and the paint chipping didnt make anyone feel comfortabke or invited. Don't put in your headphones they will call your number and you'll miss it. You'll want to with people on their phones and this lovely guy that had his phone blasting videos without headphones. Everyone speaks Spanish and English which is great. Once you actually get help the staff are very nice and knowledgeable. Two stars for the front desk people. 0 stars for the waiting room. And four stars to the seamstress workers!

Once you actually get help the staff are very nice and knowledgeable. Two stars for the front desk people. 0 stars for the waiting room. And four stars to the seamstress workers!

originalText.text: the pants when I wash them shrink in height and width.  The employees say: "go dry clean every week for a year" so it doesn't shrink. I asked them to give me a larger size number because the pants shrink when washed.  Bad experience and bad customer service with the delivery of uniforms.  but I can't do I have to take what they give me.  this is the company policy
